intro: Bupleurum sikkimensis, commonly known as the Sikkim bupleurum, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas at higher elevations. It has a taproot system and is often found in mountainous regions of India, Nepal, and Bhutan. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural gardens.
